text: I'm Simon hey I'm one of the cofounders
of Firefly learning we supercharge the
school experience so that every student
can reach their full potential it
started when we were at school ourselves
we were students frustrated with not
being able to get to things online
because only the really technical
teachers were able to make that happen
and we thought if we could make that as
straightforward as possible then we
might break this vicious cycle where
nothing was up there that we didn't
bother looking and we weren't looking so
the teachers didn't try and figure it
out we decided to move to AWS cloud
because we were fed up of having to
replace fans on servers in a data center
in Maidenhead in the middle of the night
but ultimately it's allowed us to scale
our business much more quickly than we
would otherwise have been able to
without scaling our team nearly as quick
all of our businesses on AWS we don't
own a single server and Firefly the
application is delivered through AWS in
lots of different regions around the
world pipe layer is built on ec2 and RDS
and s3 and we also take advantage of
many of the ancillary services that AWS
provides to glue all of that together
the thing that made the biggest
difference to us I think was moving to
RDS and letting Amazon manage all of
those databases for us rather than all
something to do that ourselves so we
still only have a single database
administrator in-house even though the
business has grown hugely since then the
Amazon team have been really helpful for
us in getting up and running and making
sure that we're using AWS in the most
effective and efficient way that we can
so I would definitely take their advice
and hopefully that can let you
concentrate on growing the business and
doing the things that you know and
understand best I think
AWS Head Start is going to help connect
us to a wider community of other EdTech
businesses in similar spaces so we can
swap war stories and exchange ideas and
who knows perhaps even find
opportunities for partnerships and
collaborations but also deeper
connections within Amazon so that we can
work more collaboratively with the AWS
team as we scale up and make sure that
we're making the most of what AWS can
offer us
[Music]
you
